ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Copyright (c) 2013 Trymaran, Inc. All rights reserved.
. $global_conf set -e set -x
DISPLAY=:0.0 export DISPLAY xhost +SI:localuser:oracle /usr/bin/xdpyinfo
# Establish current timestamp timestamp=`date +%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M`
# Establish working directory WORKING_DIR="/tmp" test -n "$TMP_DIR" && WORKING_DIR=$TMP_DIR
RSP_FILE="$WORKING_DIR/soa.rsp"
cat > $RSP_FILE << End [ENGINE] #DO NOT CHANGE THIS. Response File Version=1.0.0.0.0
[GENERIC] # Set this to true if you wish to specify a directory where latest updates are downloaded. # This option would use the software updates from the specified directory SPECIFY_DOWNLOAD_LOCATION=false
#Set this to true to skip the Software updates SKIP_SOFTWARE_UPDATES=true SOFTWARE_UPDATES_DOWNLOAD_LOCATION=
# Provide the Oracle Home location. # The location has to be the immediate child under the specified Middleware Home location. ORACLE_HOME=$MW_HOME/$SOA_ORACLE_HOME
#Provide existing Middleware Home location. MIDDLEWARE_HOME=$MW_HOME
#Application Server choices are WLS, WAS APPSERVER_TYPE=WLS
#Provide the Application Server Location. APPSERVER_LOCATION=$MW_HOME
[SYSTEM] [APPLICATIONS] [RELATIONSHIPS] End
# Unzip the installer files INSTALLER_DIR="$WORKING_DIR/installer" test -d "$INSTALLER_DIR" || mkdir $INSTALLER_DIR
unzip -q $SOA_INSTALL_ZIP_PART1 -d $INSTALLER_DIR unzip -q $SOA_INSTALL_ZIP_PART2 -d $INSTALLER_DIR chown -R $OS_USER $INSTALLER_DIR
test "$IGNORE_SYS_PREREQS" = "true" && PREREQS_ARGS="-ignoreSysPrereqs"
# Run the installer # echo $INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS if [ "$OS_USER" = "root" ]; then $INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS else su $OS_USER -c "$INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS" fi;
# Clean up rm -f $RSP_FILE rm -rf $INSTALLER_DIR if [ "$DELETE_CONTENT" = "true" ]; then rm -f $SOA_INSTALL_ZIP_PART1 $SOA_INSTALL_ZIP_PART2 fi;

ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Copyright (c) 2013 Trymaran, Inc. All rights reserved.
. $global_conf set -e
test "$ENABLED" != "true" && exit 0;
# Establish current timestamp timestamp=`date +%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M`
# Establish working directory WORKING_DIR="/tmp" test -n "$TMP_DIR" && WORKING_DIR=$TMP_DIR
RSP_FILE="$WORKING_DIR/osb.rsp"
cat > $RSP_FILE << End [ENGINE]
#DO NOT CHANGE THIS. Response File Version=1.0.0.0.0
[GENERIC] # Set this to true if you wish to specify a directory where latest updates are downloaded. # This option would use the software updates from the specified directory SPECIFY_DOWNLOAD_LOCATION=false
#Set this to true to skip the Software updates SKIP_SOFTWARE_UPDATES=true SOFTWARE_UPDATES_DOWNLOAD_LOCATION=
# Set this to true if typical installation must be done. If this is set to true, # then variable "CUSTOM TYPE" must be set to false as the variables are mutually exclusive TYPICAL TYPE=false
# Set this to true if custom installation must be done, all other required variables need to be provided. # If this is set to true then variable "TYPICAL TYPE" must be set to false as the variables are mutually exclusive. CUSTOM TYPE=true
# Set this to true if component Oracle Service Bus Examples must be installed. This input will be needed only # in the case of custom installation Oracle Service Bus Examples=true
# Set this to true if component Oracle Service Bus IDE must be installed. # This input will be needed only in the case of custom installation Oracle Service Bus IDE=false
# Provide the Oracle Home location. The location has to be the immediate child under the specified Middleware Home location. # The Oracle Home directory name may only contain alphanumeric , hyphen (-) , dot (.) and underscore (_) characters, # and it must begin with an alphanumeric character. The total length has to be less than or equal to 128 characters. # The location has to be an empty directory or a valid OSB Oracle Home. ORACLE_HOME=$MW_HOME/$OSB_ORACLE_HOME
# Provide existing Middleware Home location. MIDDLEWARE_HOME=$MW_HOME
# Give the complete path to a valid WebLogic Server Home for the corresponding Middleware Home entered. WL_HOME=$MW_HOME/wlserver_10.3
# Give the complete path to a valid OEPE Home for the corresponding Middleware Home entered. # This input will be needed in both typical and custom installations. But in case of custom installation, # Oracle Service Bus IDE must be set to true. OEPE_HOME=
[SYSTEM] [APPLICATIONS] [RELATIONSHIPS] End
# Unzip the installer files INSTALLER_DIR="$WORKING_DIR/installer" test -d "$INSTALLER_DIR" || mkdir $INSTALLER_DIR
unzip -q $OSB_INSTALL_ZIP -d $INSTALLER_DIR chown -R $OS_USER $INSTALLER_DIR
test "$IGNORE_SYS_PREREQS" = "true" && PREREQS_ARGS="-ignoreSysPrereqs"
# Run the installer # echo $INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS if [ "$OS_USER" = "root" ]; then $INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS else su $OS_USER -c "$INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS" fi;
# Clean up rm -f $RSP_FILE rm -rf $INSTALLER_DIR if [ "$DELETE_CONTENT" = "true" ]; then rm -f $OSB_INSTALL_ZIP fi;

ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Copyright (c) 2013 Trymaran, Inc. All rights reserved. . $global_conf
set -e set -x
DISPLAY=:0.0 export DISPLAY xhost +SI:localuser:oracle /usr/bin/xdpyinfo
# Establish current timestamp timestamp=`date +%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M`
/usr/sbin/groupadd oracle /usr/sbin/useradd -m -g oracle oracle echo oracle | passwd --stdin oracle /usr/sbin/useradd -m -g oracle soaadmin echo oracle | passwd --stdin soaadmin mkdir -p /oracle/middleware chown -R soaadmin:oracle /oracle/middleware chmod -R 775 /oracle/middleware mkdir -p /oracle/middleware/Oracle_SOA1 chown -R soaadmin:oracle /oracle/middleware/Oracle_SOA1 chmod -R 775 /oracle/middleware/Oracle_SOA1
mkdir /etc/oraInventory chown oracle: /etc/oraInventory cat > /etc/oraInst.loc << End inventory_loc=/etc/oraInventory # inst_group=oinstall inst_group=oracle End chown oracle: /etc/oraInst.loc
# Establish working directory WORKING_DIR="/tmp" test -n "$TMP_DIR" && WORKING_DIR=$TMP_DIR
# Establish WLS components COMPS="Common Infrastructure Engineering/Uninstall|" COMPS+="Common Infrastructure Engineering/Patch Client|" COMPS+="Common Infrastructure Engineering/Patch Attachment Facility|" COMPS+="Common Infrastructure Engineering/Clone Facility|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Core Application Server|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Administration Console|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Configuration Wizard and Upgrade Framework|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Web 2.0 HTTP Pub-Sub Server|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/WebLogic SCA|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/WebLogic JDBC Drivers|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Third Party JDBC Drivers|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/WebLogic Server Clients|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/WebLogic Web Server Plugins|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/UDDI and Xquery Support|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Evaluation Database|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Workshop Code Completion Support|" COMPS+="Oracle Configuration Manager/Data Collector|" COMPS+="Oracle Coherence/Coherence Product Files"
SILENT_XML_FILE="$WORKING_DIR/silent.xml"
cat > $SILENT_XML_FILE << End <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <bea-installer> <input-fields> <data-value name="BEAHOME" value="$MW_HOME" /> <data-value name="COMPONENT_PATHS" value="$COMPS" /> </input-fields> </bea-installer> End chmod 644 $SILENT_XML_FILE
xhost +SI:localuser:oracle
echo java -Xmx1024m -Djava.io.tmpdir=$WORKING_DIR -jar $WLS_INSTALLER_JAR -mode=silent -silent_xml=$SILENT_XML_FILE if [ "$OS_USER" = "root" ]; then java -Xmx1024m -Djava.io.tmpdir=$WORKING_DIR -jar $WLS_INSTALLER_JAR -mode=silent -silent_xml=$SILENT_XML_FILE else su $OS_USER -c "java -Xmx1024m -Djava.io.tmpdir=$WORKING_DIR -jar $WLS_INSTALLER_JAR -mode=silent -silent_xml=$SILENT_XML_FILE" fi;
# Cleanup rm -f $WORKING_DIR/silent.xml if [ "$DELETE_CONTENT" = "true" ]; then rm -f $WLS_INSTALLER_JAR fi;

task.description: A script to configure a Yum repository
task.content:
#!/bin/bash set -e
# Import global conf . $global_conf
if [ x$remove_all_repos = 'xtrue' ]; then rm -rf /etc/yum.repos.d/* fi
# Strip all chars that are not part of the whitelist fixed_repository_name=$(echo $repository_name | sed 's/[^-._a-zA-Z0-9]//')
if [ "x$fixed_repository_name" = "x" ]; then echo "Illegal characters were stripped from the provided repository_name but now it's empty. Please fix the repository_name property before re-running. Allowed character include: a-z A-Z 0-9 . _ -" exit 1 fi
cat > "/etc/yum.repos.d/$fixed_repository_name.repo" << YUMREPOCONFIG [$fixed_repository_name] name=$fixed_repository_name baseurl=$repository_url gpgcheck=0 YUMREPOCONFIG
yum repolist

script-task-version.name: Yum Repository Config
script-task-version.description: A script to configure a Yum repository

#!/bin/bash set -e
# Import global conf . $global_conf
if [ x$remove_all_repos = 'xtrue' ]; then rm -rf /etc/yum.repos.d/* fi
# Strip all chars that are not part of the whitelist fixed_repository_name=$(echo $repository_name | sed 's/[^-._a-zA-Z0-9]//')
if [ "x$fixed_repository_name" = "x" ]; then echo "Illegal characters were stripped from the provided repository_name but now it's empty. Please fix the repository_name property before re-running. Allowed character include: a-z A-Z 0-9 . _ -" exit 1 fi
cat > "/etc/yum.repos.d/$fixed_repository_name.repo" << YUMREPOCONFIG [$fixed_repository_name] name=$fixed_repository_name baseurl=$repository_url gpgcheck=0 YUMREPOCONFIG
yum repolist

meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

task.content:
#!/bin/bash # Copyright (c) 2013 Trymaran, Inc. All rights reserved. . $global_conf
set -e set -x
DISPLAY=:0.0 export DISPLAY xhost +SI:localuser:oracle /usr/bin/xdpyinfo
# Establish current timestamp timestamp=`date +%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M`
/usr/sbin/groupadd oracle /usr/sbin/useradd -m -g oracle oracle echo oracle | passwd --stdin oracle /usr/sbin/useradd -m -g oracle soaadmin echo oracle | passwd --stdin soaadmin mkdir -p /oracle/middleware chown -R soaadmin:oracle /oracle/middleware chmod -R 775 /oracle/middleware mkdir -p /oracle/middleware/Oracle_SOA1 chown -R soaadmin:oracle /oracle/middleware/Oracle_SOA1 chmod -R 775 /oracle/middleware/Oracle_SOA1
mkdir /etc/oraInventory chown oracle: /etc/oraInventory cat > /etc/oraInst.loc << End inventory_loc=/etc/oraInventory # inst_group=oinstall inst_group=oracle End chown oracle: /etc/oraInst.loc
# Establish working directory WORKING_DIR="/tmp" test -n "$TMP_DIR" && WORKING_DIR=$TMP_DIR
# Establish WLS components COMPS="Common Infrastructure Engineering/Uninstall|" COMPS+="Common Infrastructure Engineering/Patch Client|" COMPS+="Common Infrastructure Engineering/Patch Attachment Facility|" COMPS+="Common Infrastructure Engineering/Clone Facility|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Core Application Server|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Administration Console|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Configuration Wizard and Upgrade Framework|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Web 2.0 HTTP Pub-Sub Server|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/WebLogic SCA|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/WebLogic JDBC Drivers|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Third Party JDBC Drivers|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/WebLogic Server Clients|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/WebLogic Web Server Plugins|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/UDDI and Xquery Support|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Evaluation Database|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Workshop Code Completion Support|" COMPS+="Oracle Configuration Manager/Data Collector|" COMPS+="Oracle Coherence/Coherence Product Files"
SILENT_XML_FILE="$WORKING_DIR/silent.xml"
cat > $SILENT_XML_FILE << End <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <bea-installer> <input-fields> <data-value name="BEAHOME" value="$MW_HOME" /> <data-value name="COMPONENT_PATHS" value="$COMPS" /> </input-fields> </bea-installer> End chmod 644 $SILENT_XML_FILE
xhost +SI:localuser:oracle
echo java -Xmx1024m -Djava.io.tmpdir=$WORKING_DIR -jar $WLS_INSTALLER_JAR -mode=silent -silent_xml=$SILENT_XML_FILE if [ "$OS_USER" = "root" ]; then java -Xmx1024m -Djava.io.tmpdir=$WORKING_DIR -jar $WLS_INSTALLER_JAR -mode=silent -silent_xml=$SILENT_XML_FILE else su $OS_USER -c "java -Xmx1024m -Djava.io.tmpdir=$WORKING_DIR -jar $WLS_INSTALLER_JAR -mode=silent -silent_xml=$SILENT_XML_FILE" fi;
# Cleanup rm -f $WORKING_DIR/silent.xml if [ "$DELETE_CONTENT" = "true" ]; then rm -f $WLS_INSTALLER_JAR fi;

#!/bin/bash # Copyright (c) 2013 Trymaran, Inc. All rights reserved.
. $global_conf set -e set -x
DISPLAY=:0.0 export DISPLAY xhost +SI:localuser:oracle /usr/bin/xdpyinfo
# Establish current timestamp timestamp=`date +%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M`
# Establish working directory WORKING_DIR="/tmp" test -n "$TMP_DIR" && WORKING_DIR=$TMP_DIR
RSP_FILE="$WORKING_DIR/soa.rsp"
cat > $RSP_FILE << End [ENGINE] #DO NOT CHANGE THIS. Response File Version=1.0.0.0.0
[GENERIC] # Set this to true if you wish to specify a directory where latest updates are downloaded. # This option would use the software updates from the specified directory SPECIFY_DOWNLOAD_LOCATION=false
#Set this to true to skip the Software updates SKIP_SOFTWARE_UPDATES=true SOFTWARE_UPDATES_DOWNLOAD_LOCATION=
# Provide the Oracle Home location. # The location has to be the immediate child under the specified Middleware Home location. ORACLE_HOME=$MW_HOME/$SOA_ORACLE_HOME
#Provide existing Middleware Home location. MIDDLEWARE_HOME=$MW_HOME
#Application Server choices are WLS, WAS APPSERVER_TYPE=WLS
#Provide the Application Server Location. APPSERVER_LOCATION=$MW_HOME
[SYSTEM] [APPLICATIONS] [RELATIONSHIPS] End
# Unzip the installer files INSTALLER_DIR="$WORKING_DIR/installer" test -d "$INSTALLER_DIR" || mkdir $INSTALLER_DIR
unzip -q $SOA_INSTALL_ZIP_PART1 -d $INSTALLER_DIR unzip -q $SOA_INSTALL_ZIP_PART2 -d $INSTALLER_DIR chown -R $OS_USER $INSTALLER_DIR
test "$IGNORE_SYS_PREREQS" = "true" && PREREQS_ARGS="-ignoreSysPrereqs"
# Run the installer # echo $INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS if [ "$OS_USER" = "root" ]; then $INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS else su $OS_USER -c "$INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS" fi;
# Clean up rm -f $RSP_FILE rm -rf $INSTALLER_DIR if [ "$DELETE_CONTENT" = "true" ]; then rm -f $SOA_INSTALL_ZIP_PART1 $SOA_INSTALL_ZIP_PART2 fi;

#!/bin/bash # Copyright (c) 2013 Trymaran, Inc. All rights reserved.
. $global_conf set -e
test "$ENABLED" != "true" && exit 0;
# Establish current timestamp timestamp=`date +%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M`
# Establish working directory WORKING_DIR="/tmp" test -n "$TMP_DIR" && WORKING_DIR=$TMP_DIR
RSP_FILE="$WORKING_DIR/osb.rsp"
cat > $RSP_FILE << End [ENGINE]
#DO NOT CHANGE THIS. Response File Version=1.0.0.0.0
[GENERIC] # Set this to true if you wish to specify a directory where latest updates are downloaded. # This option would use the software updates from the specified directory SPECIFY_DOWNLOAD_LOCATION=false
#Set this to true to skip the Software updates SKIP_SOFTWARE_UPDATES=true SOFTWARE_UPDATES_DOWNLOAD_LOCATION=
# Set this to true if typical installation must be done. If this is set to true, # then variable "CUSTOM TYPE" must be set to false as the variables are mutually exclusive TYPICAL TYPE=false
# Set this to true if custom installation must be done, all other required variables need to be provided. # If this is set to true then variable "TYPICAL TYPE" must be set to false as the variables are mutually exclusive. CUSTOM TYPE=true
# Set this to true if component Oracle Service Bus Examples must be installed. This input will be needed only # in the case of custom installation Oracle Service Bus Examples=true
# Set this to true if component Oracle Service Bus IDE must be installed. # This input will be needed only in the case of custom installation Oracle Service Bus IDE=false
# Provide the Oracle Home location. The location has to be the immediate child under the specified Middleware Home location. # The Oracle Home directory name may only contain alphanumeric , hyphen (-) , dot (.) and underscore (_) characters, # and it must begin with an alphanumeric character. The total length has to be less than or equal to 128 characters. # The location has to be an empty directory or a valid OSB Oracle Home. ORACLE_HOME=$MW_HOME/$OSB_ORACLE_HOME
# Provide existing Middleware Home location. MIDDLEWARE_HOME=$MW_HOME
# Give the complete path to a valid WebLogic Server Home for the corresponding Middleware Home entered. WL_HOME=$MW_HOME/wlserver_10.3
# Give the complete path to a valid OEPE Home for the corresponding Middleware Home entered. # This input will be needed in both typical and custom installations. But in case of custom installation, # Oracle Service Bus IDE must be set to true. OEPE_HOME=
[SYSTEM] [APPLICATIONS] [RELATIONSHIPS] End
# Unzip the installer files INSTALLER_DIR="$WORKING_DIR/installer" test -d "$INSTALLER_DIR" || mkdir $INSTALLER_DIR
unzip -q $OSB_INSTALL_ZIP -d $INSTALLER_DIR chown -R $OS_USER $INSTALLER_DIR
test "$IGNORE_SYS_PREREQS" = "true" && PREREQS_ARGS="-ignoreSysPrereqs"
# Run the installer # echo $INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS if [ "$OS_USER" = "root" ]; then $INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS else su $OS_USER -c "$INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS" fi;
# Clean up rm -f $RSP_FILE rm -rf $INSTALLER_DIR if [ "$DELETE_CONTENT" = "true" ]; then rm -f $OSB_INSTALL_ZIP fi;

ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Copyright (c) 2013 Trymaran, Inc. All rights reserved.
. $global_conf set -e set -x
DISPLAY=:0.0 export DISPLAY xhost +SI:localuser:oracle /usr/bin/xdpyinfo
# Establish current timestamp timestamp=`date +%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M`
# Establish working directory WORKING_DIR="/tmp" test -n "$TMP_DIR" && WORKING_DIR=$TMP_DIR
RSP_FILE="$WORKING_DIR/soa.rsp"
cat > $RSP_FILE << End [ENGINE] #DO NOT CHANGE THIS. Response File Version=1.0.0.0.0
[GENERIC] # Set this to true if you wish to specify a directory where latest updates are downloaded. # This option would use the software updates from the specified directory SPECIFY_DOWNLOAD_LOCATION=false
#Set this to true to skip the Software updates SKIP_SOFTWARE_UPDATES=true SOFTWARE_UPDATES_DOWNLOAD_LOCATION=
# Provide the Oracle Home location. # The location has to be the immediate child under the specified Middleware Home location. ORACLE_HOME=$MW_HOME/$SOA_ORACLE_HOME
#Provide existing Middleware Home location. MIDDLEWARE_HOME=$MW_HOME
#Application Server choices are WLS, WAS APPSERVER_TYPE=WLS
#Provide the Application Server Location. APPSERVER_LOCATION=$MW_HOME
[SYSTEM] [APPLICATIONS] [RELATIONSHIPS] End
# Unzip the installer files INSTALLER_DIR="$WORKING_DIR/installer" test -d "$INSTALLER_DIR" || mkdir $INSTALLER_DIR
unzip -q $SOA_INSTALL_ZIP_PART1 -d $INSTALLER_DIR unzip -q $SOA_INSTALL_ZIP_PART2 -d $INSTALLER_DIR chown -R $OS_USER $INSTALLER_DIR
test "$IGNORE_SYS_PREREQS" = "true" && PREREQS_ARGS="-ignoreSysPrereqs"
# Run the installer # echo $INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS if [ "$OS_USER" = "root" ]; then $INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS else su $OS_USER -c "$INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS" fi;
# Clean up rm -f $RSP_FILE rm -rf $INSTALLER_DIR if [ "$DELETE_CONTENT" = "true" ]; then rm -f $SOA_INSTALL_ZIP_PART1 $SOA_INSTALL_ZIP_PART2 fi;

ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Copyright (c) 2013 Trymaran, Inc. All rights reserved.
. $global_conf set -e
test "$ENABLED" != "true" && exit 0;
# Establish current timestamp timestamp=`date +%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M`
# Establish working directory WORKING_DIR="/tmp" test -n "$TMP_DIR" && WORKING_DIR=$TMP_DIR
RSP_FILE="$WORKING_DIR/osb.rsp"
cat > $RSP_FILE << End [ENGINE]
#DO NOT CHANGE THIS. Response File Version=1.0.0.0.0
[GENERIC] # Set this to true if you wish to specify a directory where latest updates are downloaded. # This option would use the software updates from the specified directory SPECIFY_DOWNLOAD_LOCATION=false
#Set this to true to skip the Software updates SKIP_SOFTWARE_UPDATES=true SOFTWARE_UPDATES_DOWNLOAD_LOCATION=
# Set this to true if typical installation must be done. If this is set to true, # then variable "CUSTOM TYPE" must be set to false as the variables are mutually exclusive TYPICAL TYPE=false
# Set this to true if custom installation must be done, all other required variables need to be provided. # If this is set to true then variable "TYPICAL TYPE" must be set to false as the variables are mutually exclusive. CUSTOM TYPE=true
# Set this to true if component Oracle Service Bus Examples must be installed. This input will be needed only # in the case of custom installation Oracle Service Bus Examples=true
# Set this to true if component Oracle Service Bus IDE must be installed. # This input will be needed only in the case of custom installation Oracle Service Bus IDE=false
# Provide the Oracle Home location. The location has to be the immediate child under the specified Middleware Home location. # The Oracle Home directory name may only contain alphanumeric , hyphen (-) , dot (.) and underscore (_) characters, # and it must begin with an alphanumeric character. The total length has to be less than or equal to 128 characters. # The location has to be an empty directory or a valid OSB Oracle Home. ORACLE_HOME=$MW_HOME/$OSB_ORACLE_HOME
# Provide existing Middleware Home location. MIDDLEWARE_HOME=$MW_HOME
# Give the complete path to a valid WebLogic Server Home for the corresponding Middleware Home entered. WL_HOME=$MW_HOME/wlserver_10.3
# Give the complete path to a valid OEPE Home for the corresponding Middleware Home entered. # This input will be needed in both typical and custom installations. But in case of custom installation, # Oracle Service Bus IDE must be set to true. OEPE_HOME=
[SYSTEM] [APPLICATIONS] [RELATIONSHIPS] End
# Unzip the installer files INSTALLER_DIR="$WORKING_DIR/installer" test -d "$INSTALLER_DIR" || mkdir $INSTALLER_DIR
unzip -q $OSB_INSTALL_ZIP -d $INSTALLER_DIR chown -R $OS_USER $INSTALLER_DIR
test "$IGNORE_SYS_PREREQS" = "true" && PREREQS_ARGS="-ignoreSysPrereqs"
# Run the installer # echo $INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS if [ "$OS_USER" = "root" ]; then $INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS else su $OS_USER -c "$INSTALLER_DIR/Disk1/runInstaller -waitForCompletion -silent -jreLoc $JRE_LOC -response $RSP_FILE $PREREQS_ARGS" fi;
# Clean up rm -f $RSP_FILE rm -rf $INSTALLER_DIR if [ "$DELETE_CONTENT" = "true" ]; then rm -f $OSB_INSTALL_ZIP fi;

ns7:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Copyright (c) 2013 Trymaran, Inc. All rights reserved. . $global_conf
set -e set -x
DISPLAY=:0.0 export DISPLAY xhost +SI:localuser:oracle /usr/bin/xdpyinfo
# Establish current timestamp timestamp=`date +%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M`
/usr/sbin/groupadd oracle /usr/sbin/useradd -m -g oracle oracle echo oracle | passwd --stdin oracle /usr/sbin/useradd -m -g oracle soaadmin echo oracle | passwd --stdin soaadmin mkdir -p /oracle/middleware chown -R soaadmin:oracle /oracle/middleware chmod -R 775 /oracle/middleware mkdir -p /oracle/middleware/Oracle_SOA1 chown -R soaadmin:oracle /oracle/middleware/Oracle_SOA1 chmod -R 775 /oracle/middleware/Oracle_SOA1
mkdir /etc/oraInventory chown oracle: /etc/oraInventory cat > /etc/oraInst.loc << End inventory_loc=/etc/oraInventory # inst_group=oinstall inst_group=oracle End chown oracle: /etc/oraInst.loc
# Establish working directory WORKING_DIR="/tmp" test -n "$TMP_DIR" && WORKING_DIR=$TMP_DIR
# Establish WLS components COMPS="Common Infrastructure Engineering/Uninstall|" COMPS+="Common Infrastructure Engineering/Patch Client|" COMPS+="Common Infrastructure Engineering/Patch Attachment Facility|" COMPS+="Common Infrastructure Engineering/Clone Facility|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Core Application Server|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Administration Console|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Configuration Wizard and Upgrade Framework|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Web 2.0 HTTP Pub-Sub Server|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/WebLogic SCA|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/WebLogic JDBC Drivers|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Third Party JDBC Drivers|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/WebLogic Server Clients|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/WebLogic Web Server Plugins|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/UDDI and Xquery Support|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Evaluation Database|" COMPS+="WebLogic Server/Workshop Code Completion Support|" COMPS+="Oracle Configuration Manager/Data Collector|" COMPS+="Oracle Coherence/Coherence Product Files"
SILENT_XML_FILE="$WORKING_DIR/silent.xml"
cat > $SILENT_XML_FILE << End <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <bea-installer> <input-fields> <data-value name="BEAHOME" value="$MW_HOME" /> <data-value name="COMPONENT_PATHS" value="$COMPS" /> </input-fields> </bea-installer> End chmod 644 $SILENT_XML_FILE
xhost +SI:localuser:oracle
echo java -Xmx1024m -Djava.io.tmpdir=$WORKING_DIR -jar $WLS_INSTALLER_JAR -mode=silent -silent_xml=$SILENT_XML_FILE if [ "$OS_USER" = "root" ]; then java -Xmx1024m -Djava.io.tmpdir=$WORKING_DIR -jar $WLS_INSTALLER_JAR -mode=silent -silent_xml=$SILENT_XML_FILE else su $OS_USER -c "java -Xmx1024m -Djava.io.tmpdir=$WORKING_DIR -jar $WLS_INSTALLER_JAR -mode=silent -silent_xml=$SILENT_XML_FILE" fi;
# Cleanup rm -f $WORKING_DIR/silent.xml if [ "$DELETE_CONTENT" = "true" ]; then rm -f $WLS_INSTALLER_JAR fi;
